extends java.lang.Object
    Implemented according to Wiki-Pseudocode http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ramer�Douglas�Peucker_algorithm
    Author:
    Philipp Baldauf & Phliipp Jahoda

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void algorithmDouglasPeucker(java.util.List<Entry> entries, double epsilon, int start, int end)
      apply the Douglas-Peucker-Reduction to an List of Entry with a given epsilon (tolerance)
      double calcAngle(Entry p1, Entry p2)
      calculates the angle between two Entries (points) in the chart

      Calculates the angle between two given lines.
      double calcAngleWithRatios(Entry p1, Entry p2)
      calculates the angle between two Entries (points) in the chart taking ratios into consideration

      uses the douglas peuker algorithm to reduce the given List of entries

      Sets the ratios for x- and y-axis, as well as the ratio of the scale levels

    • Method Detail

      • setup

        public void setup(Approximator.ApproximatorType type,
                  double tolerance)
        sets type and tolerance, if tolerance <= 0, no filtering will be done
        Parameters:
        type -
        tolerance -

      • setTolerance

        public void setTolerance(double tolerance)
        sets the tolerance for the Approximator. When using the Douglas-Peucker-Algorithm, the tolerance is an angle in degrees, that will trigger the filtering.

      • setType

        public void setType(Approximator.ApproximatorType type)
        Sets the filtering algorithm that should be used.

        Parameters:

        Returns:

                                    double tolerance)

        Parameters:
